discussion.content: "Patching" because malware has been "sent", so patching the target software/system with fixed code can block the effects of malware.
can someone please explain this? It would be much appreciated.

comments.content: Patch(update) the system(windows ect) to block the malware

The idea here is that by keeping the system updated with the latest patches, you are doing the best you can to fix any vulnerability in the O/S (or software) that the malware might exploit.
That is regardless of any other protection measure you may have implemented.

questions.question_text: Which of the following would MOST likely prevent malware sent as compromised file via email from infecting a person's computer?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Sequence
A sequence is designed to automatically generate and store values in a specific order, such as consecutive order numbers. This ensures that each new order receives the next available number in a structured and sequential manner.

questions.question_text: A programmer needs an element that will automatically store customer orders consecutively by order number every time a new order is placed. Which of the following elements should be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. DML (Data Manipulation Language)
DML commands, such as SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE, are used to extract and manipulate data within a database. SELECT specifically retrieves information from the database, making DML the correct category for extracting data.

questions.question_text: Which of the following categories describes commands used to extract information from a database?
Which of the following would be best to use to store a project task list that will be updated by multiple team members?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Document sharing software
Document sharing software (such as Google Docs, Microsoft OneDrive, or SharePoint) allows multiple team members to collaborate on and update a project task list in real time. It ensures version control, accessibility, and seamless collaboration.

questions.question_text: A user needs an interface that supports both video and data. Which of the following will meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Thunderbolt
Thunderbolt supports both video and data transmission, making it suitable for high-speed connections, external displays, and peripheral devices.

VGA (B) and DVI (C) are video-only interfaces.
FireWire (D) is primarily used for data transfer but does not support video output.
